short_summary: Software developer and programming services for multiple platforms
description: Please refer to the detailed information on requirements and evaluation criteria in Documents tab below.
duration_in_months: There is no fixed duration for this contract.
full_summary:
**Request for Proposal: Electronic Component Parts and Raw Materials and Accessories**

**Tender Reference Number:** cb-7490-63678208

**DC345T Proposal Number:** 202301888

**Title:** Purchase of Electronic Component Parts and Raw Materials and Accessories

**Industry Classification:** 32131000 - Electronic Component Parts and Raw Materials and Accessories

**Published:** July 24, 2023

**Closing Date:** August 7, 2023, at 2:00 PM EST

**Submission Date:** August 7, 2023

**Government Contracting Agency:** Royal Canadian Mounted Police (Gendarmerie royale du Canada)

**Competition Type:** Competitive - Selective Tendering

**Method of Award:** Lowest Price, Compliant Bidder

**Period of Performance:** August 14, 2023, to March 31, 2024

**Maximum Demand:** Two (2) packages R&S Cable Rider ZPH

**Description:** The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (Gendarmerie royale du Canada) is seeking to purchase electronic component parts and raw materials and accessories as specified in the tender package.

**Products Requirement:**

1.   Two (2) packages R&S Cable Rider ZPH
2.   Two (2) power sensor support (unregistered licenses)
3.   Two (2) 3-path diode power sensors
4.   Two (2) USB power sensor cables (1.5 meters)

**Delivery Schedule:** All products must be delivered on or before March 31, 2024.

**Language of Tender:** English and French

**Regions of Opportunity:** Newmarket, Regions of Ontario

**Regions of Delivery:** World

**Tender Document:** Can be downloaded from the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) website.

**Instructions to Tenderers:**

1.  To submit a bid, please respond to the RFP package and follow the instructions outlined within the package.
2.  Bidders are responsible for ensuring that their bid is submitted within the given deadline.
3.  Tenders must be sent directly to the RCMP Procurement Officer.
4.  Proposers have the right to negotiate contracts with the contracting authority.

**Note:** The Crown retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement. In the event of a dispute, the matter will be resolved in accordance with the laws of the province of Ontario. Terms of the payment will be discussed during the procurement process. This tender package includes all
